alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 2:01PM PST until November 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, up to 8 inches above 7000 feet, and up to 1 to 2 feet above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, with ridge top gusts up to 95 mph. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 4 PM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds could cause tree damage and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on hazardous boating conditions on Lake Tahoe with wave heights 2 to 4 feet. Localized areas of blowing snow may also reduce visibility to near zero at times.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
